#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Think in Another Language
#Text=Thinking in another language can be more useful than you think !
#Text=It can be a great way to perfect your second language , to learn a new language quicker or to raise your grades in a certain language in school .
#Text=Of course , you have to know the basics of the language before you can start thinking in it .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Immerse yourself in the language .
#Text=Learning by immersion is one of the best ways to pick up a language .
#Text=The more you 're exposed to the language , the more likely you are to begin thinking in that language .

#Text=Try going to places you 're likely to find people speaking the language , or surrounding yourself with the language by changing the language on your electronics , subscribing to newspapers written in the language , reading books and watching movies in another language , and so on .
#Text=Resist the urge to use your first language .
#Text=Immersing yourself in a new language can be quite challenging at first , but avoid using your first language as a crutch .
#Text=Try saving it for when you really need it , because every time you use your first language , you 're further off from thinking in another language .
#Text=For instance , turn off subtitles while watching movies in another language , and try to understand it naturally .
#Text=Befriend someone who speaks another language .
#Text=Find someone who speaks your new language as a first language and get in touch with them .
#Text=As you interact with them over time , you 'll find yourself thinking in their language .
#Text=If you ca n't find anyone where you live , try getting a penpal .
#Text=There are several avenues to find one online , so search websites to find someone else looking for a penpal , and write to them .
#Text=Force yourself to think in the language .
#Text=If it 's been a while and you still ca n't get yourself to think in another language , try forcing yourself to let go of your old language .
#Text=If you notice yourself thinking in your first language , scrap the thought or continue with the language you 're trying to learn. .
#Text=If you 've tried this and are still failing , it is likely that you just do n't know the language well enough , and need more practice .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you 're having an exam in your second or third language , make sure to read a book in it the day before and write in it as often as possible .
#Text=Little things make a big difference .
#Text=Try purchasing calendars , inspirational posters , cooking recipes and so on in the language you 're trying to learn .

#Text=If you 're trying to learn a second language along with your children , get children 's books and talking toys using the language , watch kids ' TV in the language with them and remember to speak the language to them .
